alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Wabash (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 1:45PM CDT until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois and southwest Indiana, including the following counties, in Illinois, Edwards and Wabash. In southwest Indiana, Gibson, Pike and Warrick. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 144 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Evansville, Princeton, Mount Carmel, Boonville, Newburgh, Chandler, Fort Branch, Oakland City, Petersburg, Albion, Grayville, Lancaster, Haubstadt, Owensville, West Salem, Lynnville, Winslow, Patoka, Folsomville and Elberfeld. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
